name: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith
description:
Decide which Jedi between Anakin Skywalker and Obi Wan Kenobi you would like to be; choose between 2 levels of difficulty and live the movie's storyline in single player mode.

The singleplayer mode is a side-scroller with a depth of field, which give a new dimension to explore while not in 3D. As you progress in the levels, the player can pick Mission Points that will help him to customize his character. It is actually the GBA version of the game but you can make the specials moves of the characters by pressing them on the touch screen. There is also 3 3D levels in each path that has been added to enhance the singleplayer experience.

In multiplayer, the player can pilot one of the 17 spacefighters in one of the 8 maps (2 in Coruscant, 4 in space, Hoth, Tatooine). The game is multi-card play and let you play against 3 other bots and/or players. In order to unlock all ships, the player will have to win in deathmatch against one of the movie's characters (Grievous, Luke Skywalker, Darth Vader, Anakin Skywalker, Boba Fett, Han Solo).

shot.caption: Title screen.
Choosing the character you want to play with
Opening scroll
Battledroids are the easiest enemies in the game
You can block a blaster shot and return it to sender
On the start, some tips (like how to make a force pull to throw a robot arm into another robot) appear occasionally
The robots are ranked by colour. The brown ones can take a few more hits.
Those green pieces are mission points. Get as many as possible to improve your abilities.
In-level cutscenes.
The first boss is Doouku himself.
Taking Palpatine to safety.
As could be expected, there's an elevator level
Things getting tougher when the Super Battle Droids appear
Jedi Master Obi Wan destroying a Droideka
Grievous makes his first appearance
Between-level cutscenes are a lot more elaborate
Adding new tricks to the repertoire.
The path forks between Obi-Wan's and Anakin's story.
Yoda and Mace Windu discuss the next assignment
As a Jedi activates Force Speed, the whole screen turns grey
Floor traps, like elevators, are a must in side-scrolling brawlers.
